book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
Praise be to Him who is unique in eternity, and singular in Lordship and Grandeur. Peace and blessings be upon our Master Muhammad, the Master of Prophets, and upon his pure family and pious companions.
To proceed, the daily events of Damascus of the Levant, most of which occurred during the days of the two great ministers: Sulayman Pasha and As'ad Pasha, who are among the notables of the ministers of Banu al-Azm the great. They were collected by the virtuous Shihab al-Din Ahmad bin Budayr al-Budayri, famous as the Barber (Al-Hallaq), from the year 1154 to the year 1176. It contained oddities, wonders, and terrors. Due to the simplicity of its author, he wrote it in colloquial language, then elaborated with additional events and rhymed supplications that bore the listener and weary the reader. So I removed the husk from these events and kept the core, and refined them as much as possible with correctness. To Him, the Exalted, is the return and destination, Amen.

Year 1154
Al-Budayri, may Allah have mercy on him, said meaning: In the year 1154, the governor of Damascus was Al-Hajj Ali Pasha, from the Turks. This was after eleven years had passed since the accession of our master Sultan Mahmud Khan son of Sultan Mustafa Khan, may Allah support the throne of this state until the end of time.
It circulated on the tongues of the common people that great earthquakes would occur in Damascus of the Levant, causing many places to collapse, and that men would turn into women, and that the rivers of Damascus would flow with food. They talked about many events like these superstitions and began circulating them among themselves, but nothing happened afterward in this year.
This year was a year of high prices in food and other things, until an ounce (uqiyya) of ghee reached five masari and a half, a rotl of rice sixteen masari, a mudd of barley eight masari, white bread twelve masari, a rotl of cakes (ka'k) fourteen masari, and brown bread a rotl for five masari.
In the previous year, the ruler of Damascus, Uthman Pasha the Collector (Al-Muhassil), expelled the Kapikulu regiment (Orta) from the Citadel of Damascus. He exiled some, killed some, and those who remained, he wrapped the turban cloth for them after a group of people testified that he was not a troublemaker (Zarbata) and no corruption occurred from him. He scattered their unity across all lands, and that was a reform. Evil was killed in Damascus of the Levant, and people's conditions improved.
The arrival of the Jukhadar from Hajj bringing good news was on the twenty-seventh day of the month of Muharram. The writers (Kattab) entered that year on the eve of Wednesday, the third night of the month of Safar. The writer was Bakir Basha al-Hamami accompanied by a group. The entry of the Hajj [caravan] into Damascus was on Saturday, the second day after the arrival of the writers. It continued to drag and withdraw for five days until the Mahmal entered. The pilgrims mentioned that they circled twice this year between the Two Holy Mosques, and they faced high prices and severe cold. Ibn Mudayyan, the Sheikh of the Arabs, was killed between the Two Holy Mosques after a fight broke out between them and the governor of Damascus, the Amir al-Hajj. Then he stayed for a while after his return from Hajj, and people were in safety and security, then he was dismissed.
The Sublime State appointed Sulayman Pasha ibn al-Azm over Damascus. Sulayman Pasha sent his Silahdar (armor-bearer), the husband of the daughter of Al-Wafa'i, as a deputy (Mutasallim) before entering Damascus. He remained for about two months without entering Damascus, then he came and camped at Al-Biqa' and wanted to besiege the Druze Mountain, but they reconciled with him for a large sum of money until they satisfied him. He entered Damascus on Thursday, the twelfth of Jumada al-Thani in this mentioned year, which is the year 1154. Three days after his entry, he crucified three wretches from the Arabs, and after that, he kept everything as it was and did not move a motionless object.
The year he entered was a manifestation of two of His Exalted Names: They are Qayyum (Self-Subsisting) and Hafiz (Preserver) for the year 1154. Sheikh Abd al-Rahman al-Bahlul, one of the writers of Damascus, organized it in a verse, saying:
In this year, He has manifested among them ... with the date Qayyum Hafiz (Self-Subsisting Preserver)
In this year, the fasting of Ramadan started on Friday, then it was proven at its end that the month started on Thursday. The Noble Mahmal left with the Pasha in the middle of Shawwal on Saturday. The next day, the Aleppo Hajj came, and with them were about three hundred Persians. After four days, the Hajj left, and a small group of pilgrims remained for the Defterdar of Sultan Mahmud Khan, so he left the next day, Thursday. The departure of the pilgrims was in Kanun al-Awwal (December), and the cold was extremely severe. Frost and ice remained on the ground for about twenty-five days, with the sun shining but the ice not melting, until it was said that nothing like it had been seen. Trees withered, and fruits were lost, especially lemons, citrons, and bitter oranges, until a rotl of charcoal was sold in Damascus for three masari. The Muzayribiyya reported after their return that charcoal was sold, every three rotls for a piastre (qirsh).

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
In this year, the Jarda (supply caravan) left on Saturday, the twenty-seventh of Dhu al-Qi'dah, and Ya'qub Pasha, the governor of Aleppo, was made Sardar (commander) over it. He was mentioned to have a pleasing biography and was just with the subjects.
Sheikh Ahmad al-Budayri said: I composed these Mawaliya (folk poetry) in this year, which is the year 1154, regarding those who spread lies and rumors that we mentioned earlier, where I said:
From the abundance of lies of the Rafidites, gray hair crept into us ... They do not know that lying is a condition of shame.
Regarding the earthquake, they spoke words of doubt ... The accursed ones began to know the Unseen.
Another:
On the eve of Saturday, the fifteenth of Muharram ... They leaned to the saying of the Rafidites, false and forbidden.
Regarding the earthquake, sleep became forbidden ... Whoever slept under the roof, O brother, at night,
Smelling the breeze between his sides became forbidden.
Another:
O people, the lie of the Rafidites spread in the regions ... And made us women sitting in the middle of the house.
May the wrath of the One, Unique, Subduer descend upon them ... They terrified the creation about this earthquake, O people,
They are the donkeys of the Jews inside Saqar in the Fire.
Another:
With proof that the Rafidite on the Day of Gathering, O good people ... are donkeys to be ridden for the Khakhan and the Jawqar.
They intended a plot in Jillaq (Damascus) that pervaded the regions ... On the eve of Saturday, they said the earthquake would happen.
Does anyone know the Unseen except the One, the Subduer?
Another:
On the eve of Saturday, they said the earthquake would happen ... And the child is confused among people from its wonder.
I ask You, O Lord, by the one who came as a bringer of glad tidings to mankind ... Wipe out the Rafidites of the people of Sham, O Worshipped One,
And burn their fathers and sink their furnace and the well.
People said a lie we had not heard ... The rivers of Sham, O brother, their water soaks,
Running with food instead of water in its course ... Fakhitiyya (dish) and yellow rice and fat meat,
Stand up and look at the Kibbeh and the ghee covered it.
Another:
I heard one saying, O brother, your pipes ... are broken, let me stand with you to help you.
Because the fats of these types help you ... And you hide them for days of high prices and drought,
Do not let the Kibbeh block it in its path from you.
Another:
In the year four with fifty, O masters ... I heard news I had not heard of as customs.
They increased in their extravagance, they did not hear the words ... All is for Allah and actions are by intentions.
Another:
I seek forgiveness from Allah, my Lord, the Sender of provisions ... One, Guardian, you find it all absolute.
And praise the Chosen One, he is the elite of the Creator ... He forgives you and with you Ahmad the Barber.

Year 1155
Then the year 1155 entered, and its first day was Thursday, which was the first of Muharram. After five days was the first of Adhar (March). In those days, a star appeared and began rising every night from the east from midnight until dawn, and it had a long tail, and it stayed for days then disappeared. Some composed a chronogram (history) containing the date for the entry of this year, which is:
We praise Allah who granted us ... A good year and endowed us with generosity.
This year has appeared, O people look ... The word of the date is an omen to be seized.
So supplicate to Allah for its completion ... with success, for you are the best of nations.
And rejoice, O nation of the Guide who ... Allah singled out with favor and wisdom.
My Lord's favor encompassed us as an honor ... The thanks for those blessings cannot be counted.
And likewise, all creation has been encompassed by ... His kindness, Glory be to Him, the Creator of souls.
Especially the band of Sham which ... is for the Abdal (substitutes/saints) a committed refuge.
How so, when the Masters have settled in it ... Their secret encompassed plain and hill.
So thank Allah for a year that has come ... The date showed preservation and blessings.
The entry of the Juqadar of Sulayman Pasha the Vizier, son of Al-Azm, in the year 1155 was on Saturday, falling on the twenty-fourth of the month of Muharram of the mentioned year. On Tuesday, the twenty-seventh of Muharram, the writers of the Noble Hajj approached. On the mentioned day, a strong wind blew for two days and two nights, uprooting many trees and demolishing countless places. A huge branch fell from the carob tree in the Hadra onto the head of an adolescent boy, killing him instantly, and two other men, crushing them, and the wind calmed down at its time.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
On Monday, the third of Safar of the mentioned year, the Syrian Hajj entered Damascus, and Sulayman Pasha Al-Azm entered the next day. He was accompanied by Ya'qub Pasha, the Sardar of the Jarda, who was separated from Aleppo. The Hajj in that year was in safety, security, prosperity, and cheap prices, except that the Pasha went between the Two Holy Mosques from Quba and exited from Mount Arafat at the Dome of Light, and returned from the path that Ali Pasha came from.
Al-Budayri said: In that year, the arrival of the decree confirming Sulayman Pasha Azm-Zade was delayed, so the riffraff and the lowly clamored in word and deed and displayed many innovations of pure prohibition, and they remained in those conditions until the decree arrived. Its entry was on the morning of the fourth of Jumada al-Thani of the mentioned year. The judge in Damascus was Abd al-Wahhab Effendi, nicknamed Aba-Zade.
In that year, Fathi Effendi ibn al-Qalanisi, the Defterdar, ordered the repair of the road to Salihiyya, so he turned over its tiles, built its platform, and improved his standing with the people.
On the first of the blessed Rajab of the year, which is the year 1155, a blessed maidservant came to us. We had bought a new house in the Ta'dil quarter, and we were in straitened circumstances, so we said: Perhaps by her arrival, victory and opening (Fatihah) will occur for us, so we named her Saliha (Righteous), may Allah Almighty make her Faliha (Successful).
On the 22nd of Jumada al-Thani, His Excellency Sulayman Pasha Al-Azm held a council (Diwan), and gathered in it the Effendis and Aghas, and issued a noble decree for justice and searching for corruptors in Damascus from the Janissaries. He summoned the heads of the Maydan, who are the Aghas, to attend, but they refused and sent to him asking what he wanted. He sent demanding from them sixteen men from the wretches whom they call in their terminology 'Zarbawat'. They sent to him saying: We cannot capture them, so you deal with them. Immediately, he removed their 'Kudkats' (titles/positions) from them and assigned them to others, and gave their names to the crier, and ordered him to call out in the streets of Damascus that the blood of these sixteen is shed with impunity, and there is no sin on whoever kills them, and others are in safety and security from Sulayman Pasha. All the people rejoiced because they were among the greatest corruptors.
The next day, the Dalatiyya killed a Janissary man, so people fled and Damascus closed down. The Pasha asked about that, and it was said to him that some Mosulis and Baghdadis who were Kapikulu and were expelled in the time of Uthman Pasha the Collector when they killed some Janissaries, now intend to cause sedition. So he ordered a crier to call out that after three days no one from the Mosulis, Baghdadis, and Kapikulu should remain, and whoever remains of them will be crucified and his property looted.
On the 24th of Jumada of this year, Judge Muhammad Effendi, nicknamed Findiq-Zade, entered and stayed in Salihiyya. The remaining term of the old judge was four [days/months?]. After completing them, the new judge commenced his function in the court.
On the evening of Tuesday, the third of Rajab of this year, Sulayman Pasha departed seeking to fight Zahir Umar, the ruler of Tiberias Fortress, accompanied by a great army, mostly Dalatiyya. He took with him bombs, miners (Laghumjiya), and gunners (Topciya) who came from Istanbul upon his request. Then he reached it and besieged it severely. His Excellency Sulayman Pasha sent asking the people of Damascus for ladders. They sent him what he requested. After a while, he sent asking for laborers and gardeners, accompanied by shovels, spades, and hoes, so all he requested was sent to him.
He continued besieging the fortress, striking it with cannons and bombs, but it did not affect it. The Druze, the people of Nablus, the deputy of Jerusalem Khalil Agha son of Abu Shanab, the Arabs of Bani Sakhr, and the Arabs of Al-Saqr with Qa'dan bin Zahir al-Salamah assisted him. They tightened the siege on the people of the fortress. However, some people of Tiberias reported that the besieged in the fortress did not suffer distress because their provisions were plentiful, and it was said that the fortress gate opened at a specific time, and some people would go to them and return with what they requested.
A supply sent to them was seized. That is because the people of Deir Hanna, where Zahir Umar's brother was, sent a letter to his brother with a person, and sent a supply of gunpowder and other things with persons. A man from Sulayman Pasha's army captured the person with the letter. After searching him, the letter was found placed in his sandal. His Excellency the Pasha took the letter, read it, and interrogated him, and he confessed to the reinforcement and supply sent to Zahir Umar's brother. Immediately, Sulayman Pasha ordered his killing, and sent a group to the people who had the supply, so it was taken from them, and they killed most of them, cut off their heads, and Sulayman Pasha sent them to Istanbul. He tightened the siege and Sulayman Pasha sent to Zahir Umar's brother who was in Deir Hanna saying to him: When we finish with your brother, we will come to you, Allah willing. The completion of its conquest will come, Allah Almighty willing.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
The crescent moon of Ramadan in this year was on Monday and was confirmed after Isha. Lamps were lit in all the minarets of Damascus, and cannons of confirmation were fired at midnight. People experienced crowding in the Suhur movement, so food shops like bakers and grocers opened at night.
On the ninth of the mentioned Ramadan, heavy rains fell on the entire country, praise be to Allah. A ship sank on the coast of Sidon during that period, coming from Egypt with many provisions; may Allah compensate its owners with good. It was said that it sank in the storm of Qasim Koy.
The Surra (purse/money sent to Mecca) came from Istanbul on Friday, and the Imperial Treasury came from Egypt on Saturday the thirteenth of Ramadan, having been delayed from its time. Its Sanjak (flag-bearer/commander) was Umar Bey. The Baltajiyya (axemen/guards) came from Istanbul on Monday in the mentioned month. Despite that, His Excellency Sulayman Pasha Al-Azm was besieging Tiberias, and had tightened on its people as will come.
On Tuesday the twenty-third of this month, the month of Ramadan, the righteous man Al-Hajj Ahmad Al-Hallaq bin Hashish passed away. He was a righteous man who saw wonders because he traveled a lot. He was good in companionship and affection, and was a barber for the unique of his time and pole of his era Sheikh Abd al-Ghani al-Nabulsi, may his secret be sanctified. He also used to shave for Sheikh Murad Effendi al-Naqshbandi the Cripple, and for the pillar of the Shafi'i school our Sheikh Muhammad al-Ajluni and their likes. He used to shave for free for the poor students of knowledge and others. From his righteousness and piety is that he never placed his hand on a sick person with ophthalmia and read what was easy [from Quran] except that Allah healed him and cured him. Its historian, the barber Sheikh Ahmad al-Budayri, said: The subject of the biography was my master and teacher in the craft of barbering, and from him I received openings and blessings, may Allah Almighty have mercy on him.
The next day, Wednesday, Sheikh Mustafa al-Mugharbil passed away. He was a religious man who took the Path from the Master Sheikh Yusuf al-Tabbakh.
In those times, high prices intensified in all things, especially foodstuffs, despite the existence of grains and other things. Due to the lack of inspection by the rulers, sellers sold at whatever [price] they wanted. However, sheep were very scarce, so butchers slaughtered buffaloes, camels, and goats. A rotl of Damascene meat was sold for thirty masari, a rotl of sheep tail fat for a piastre and a quarter, eggs two for a masriyyah, ghee a rotl and two ounces for a piastre, garlic a rotl for thirty masari, and a rotl of bread for four masari and five masari and more. It had been three masari and a half. With the arrival of the blessed month of Ramadan, prices rose, even vegetables. Before Ramadan, zucchini was a hundred for a masriyyah, but when Ramadan began, it became five and four for a masriyyah. Eggplant was two rotls for a masriyyah, then became every rotl for two masriyyahs. Meat was non-existent. All this was due to the lack of inspection by the rulers.
The day of Eid al-Fitr was Wednesday, and we fasted thirty days completing the number. Eid entered, and His Excellency the Governor of Damascus Sulayman Pasha did not come from the Dawra (tour), rather he is still residing at the siege of Tiberias Fortress.
On Saturday the fourth of Shawwal, an official announcement came from His Excellency Sulayman Pasha of the conquest of Tiberias Fortress. Cannons were fired, decorations were made, and drums and horns were played. The next day, Sunday, His Excellency Sulayman Pasha Al-Azm entered Damascus. His deputy (Kikhiya) and the army preceded him, and he left Ali Agha Ibn al-Tarjuman at Tiberias Fortress, with some soldiers and laborers, and ordered him not to come to Damascus until he destroys it after expelling its people from it.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
The historian said: It reached me that the reason for its conquest was that when the siege intensified on its people, and provisions decreased among them, and they were unable to bring food due to the soldiers and Bedouins surrounding them, and that after striking with cannons and bombs, His Excellency Sulayman Pasha ordered digging trenches and a mine two hundred and eighty cubits long. When this reached them, the world narrowed upon them and their panic increased. Zahir Umar, the besieged Sheikh of Tiberias, sent to Umar Bey, the Sanjak of the Egyptian Treasury which comes to the Sublime State with ample appearance, to mediate peace between him and His Excellency Sulayman Pasha. This was before his arrival and the arrival of the Treasury to Damascus.
When it arrived, Umar Bey marched and entered upon His Excellency Sulayman Pasha as a ruler in Egypt. Umar Bey was a dignified elderly man, and he said to him: O Excellency the Vizier, I am an elderly man in the position of your father, even if I am among your servants, and I enter upon your status for peace between you and the servant of your bounty and state Zahir Umar, Sheikh of Tiberias. Forgiveness is from the traits of the noble, and you are the noble, none other. His Excellency the Pasha answered him that it will be good, Allah Almighty willing.
When it was the second day of Eid, Eid al-Fitr, the matter intensified on the people of Tiberias, and the siege increased on them. They went out to the top of the walls raising their voices calling His Excellency Ali Agha al-Tarjuman. When he approached them, they said to him: You have safety (Aman), enter the gate. So he took permission from the Pasha and entered the gate. His Excellency Sulayman Pasha had been overtaken by the travel to Hajj. So Ali Agha entered Tiberias Fortress and the Sheikhs met him, and with them Zahir Umar. They fell at his feet and began weeping around him, and prepared for him ten purses [of money], to intervene between them and His Excellency Sulayman Pasha for peace. Then the women, children, and elders came out weeping and wailing, so he felt pity for them, and marched seeking His Excellency the Pasha.
When he reached him, he fell at his feet, and admonished him with clemency and compassion, and mentioned to him the virtues of good morals. So his heart softened and he answered his request. When the besieged knew and verified that His Excellency the Pasha pardoned them and forgave, the women, men, and children came out, with handkerchiefs around their necks and humiliation upon them, raising palms of supplication with submission, and clamoring with prayers for him and the Grand Sultan. They paid His Excellency two hundred and so purses of money after he took the son of Zahir Umar as a hostage and came to him to Damascus. He sent a group to demolish the fortress and annihilate it.
The historian said: Thus Ali Agha Shatir Bashi narrated this. It was reported to us in a different way. Allah knows best the reality of the situation.
On Friday, the tenth of Shawwal of this year, the noble descendant Sayyid Abdullah bin Ajlan, the Naqib (Head) of the Sadah Ashraf (Nobles/Descendants of the Prophet) in Damascus passed away. He was buried in their cemetery in the Sheep Market due to the narrowness of the Muradiyya Mosque. He was at that time removed from the NIqaba (position of Head), which was upon his nephew Sayyid Ali Effendi.
On that day, Sayyid Ali Effendi was removed from the Niqaba, and it was assigned to Sayyid Muhammad Effendi son of Sheikh Abd al-Qadir al-Gilani. On that day also, Hamid Effendi Ibn al-Imadi was removed from the position of Ifta (issuing fatwas) and it was assigned to his cousin Muhammad Effendi Ibn al-Imadi.
The historian, may Allah have mercy on him, said: On the eve of Saturday, the eleventh of Shawwal, my mother passed away in the first third of the night. May Allah have mercy on her, forgive her, and cool her resting place. She left the world while I was sleeping between her feet. She was among the devout worshipers, praying voluntary night prayers, and hadlitanies, to the end of what he said.
In that month of this year, after Friday prayer, the Noble Mahmal left with the perilous Vizier Sulayman Pasha bin al-Azm. The next day, Saturday, the Aleppo Hajj came, and with it were a thousand and seven hundred Persians. On the twentieth of Shawwal, the Hajj left the city little by little. Before the departure of Vizier Sulayman Pasha, he held a council and brought the notables, and showed the Firman (decree) which contained the killing of the Zarbawat, meaning the corruptors from the Janissaries. He said to those present: This decree whose command is delegated to us, we have cancelled it and pardoned them. This was counted among his good deeds.
The first day of the winter season in this year was from Wednesday the twenty-ninth of Shawwal, which is the day of the entry of the Muzayribiyya. The Pasha stayed in Muzayrib for four days and departed on the fifth day. The Arabs of Bani Sakhr carried the Hajj. Everything was cheap from all goods except Ma'muk, and barley was a mudd for half a piastre. Many servants returned. The sky rained heavily on the day the Muzayribiyya arrived after they had despaired, so all creation rejoiced and praised the Creator for His kindness.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
On the tenth of Dhu al-Qi'dah, Mustafa Pasha, the governor of Tripoli of Syria, entered Damascus on Monday. The Sublime State appointed him Sardar over the Jarda. The aforementioned was a shedder of blood, unjust and tyrannical. He shed much blood when he was in Tripoli. Most of his killing was by dogs and hooks, leaving the man until he died of hunger and thirst. So most of the people of Tripoli fled from his injustice and scattered in the lands. He sent his aides in pursuit of the fugitives, and whoever they caught was among the perished.
After his arrival in Damascus, a sedition occurred between the Dalatiyya belonging to the Mutasallim and the Levend Kurds. A group from both sides was killed. That sedition was on a Friday, so Friday prayer was cancelled in many mosques.
On the first of Dhu al-Hijjah, the end of the mentioned year, Sheikh Muhammad al-Kayyal passed away. He was one of the heads of muezzins in the Umayyad Mosque. He was a righteous man, and used to copy books and other things with an acceptable handwriting. He used to sleep with the pen in his hand, wake up, and write without looking at the writing. This was counted as a karamah (miracle) for him.
On that day, news came of the killing of the Mutasallim of Damascus. The Arabs of Zubaid killed him and killed a large group of his soldiers. That was because these Arabs were rebellious against the State. The mentioned Mutasallim went out with a group of soldiers, and they marched until they reached the mentioned Arabs. The Mutasallim and his soldiers surprised them while unaware with killing and other things, and wanted to take their wealth and livestock. So they retaliated against them with a jealous and patient response, killing the mentioned Mutasallim and a group of his soldiers.
When this matter reached the dignitaries of Damascus, they held a council and then ordered a crier to call out: Whoever wants obedience to Allah and the Sultan, from those capable and strong to ride, let him not lag behind. So raid, raid against the Arabs of Zubaid who killed the Mutasallim and his soldiers. The Janissaries, Sipahis, and leaders went out. They appointed Hussein Agha bin al-Qutayfani, the administrator of the endowment of the late Sinan Pasha, as a deputy in Damascus. Then they marched to the Arabs, and returned with the body of the killed Mutasallim, which was in a state of lesson for those who take heed. Then they washed him in the government palace and buried him in Bab al-Saghir.
His name was Ibrahim, and he was a Mamluk of Sulayman Pasha bin al-Azm, the ruler of Damascus. Despite his master's justice, he had injustice, aggression, and audacity against the elite and commoners. He used to order the arrest of everyone he saw after Isha, and order him to be shackled immediately with iron, until he took much money from him. If someone committed a sin, and he could not capture him, he would capture whoever he could of his family and relatives, and force him to pay a large sum. If someone forbade him from those conditions, he would get angry and seek to depart. He continued in his injustice and arrogance until Allah took him.
It was said the reason for his destruction was that the Sheikh of Al-Jabla, Al-Fuhayli, came to him and said secretly: Rise so I can help you gain many spoils. No one from the grandees of Damascus knew, except his tyrannical people. So he and his people went until he reached Al-Lajat. When he reached that tribe, he drove their wealth and women. The Arabs turned back on him, and one of them took aim at him and hit him and did not miss, leaving him lying dead, and they killed a group of his people. That is for what his hands sent forth.
On Saturday, mid-Dhu al-Hijjah, our father, parent, teacher, and educator Sulayman bin al-Hashish the Hakawati (Storyteller) passed away, may Allah have mercy on him. He was unique in his age and singular in his time. He used to narrate the biography of Al-Zahir, Antara, and Sayf, and strange anecdotes in Turkish and Arabic, yet he was illiterate, neither reading nor writing. He was blond, leprous, intensely white, except that he was a vast ocean that could not be waded, may Allah have mercy on him.
On Saturday, the fifteenth of Dhu al-Hijjah, the late Abd al-Aziz Effendi al-Safarjalani passed away. He was a jurist who loved scholars, accepted by rulers, feared and dignified. He was given a status that no one from Banu al-Safarjalani attained, loving to do good, and for this, he gained acceptance among the elite and commoners.
In the early winter of the end of this year, rains were scarce, people despaired, and prices rose significantly. Then Allah aided His servants with rains like seas, and that was at the beginning of Kanun al-Thani (January). It continued night and day without slackening. The world snowed seven times, and that continued for forty-five days. Many places collapsed so that no place or direction remained in Damascus except that demolition occurred in it. Then after that, the sun rose, and Allah revived the earth after its death.

Year 1156
Then the year 1156, one thousand one hundred and fifty-six, entered on Monday, the first of Muharram. May Allah make it a year of good, mercy, and blessing. The governor in Damascus of the Levant was Sulayman Pasha al-Azm, who was in the caravan of the Noble Hajj.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
This new year has begun, and a rotl of Damascene bread is at four or five masari, a rotl of rice at eight masari, a rotl of dibs (molasses) at eight masari, and an ounce of ghee at six masari and it is not found, although about a month ago every rotl and eight ounces was for a piastre. But the hoarder left no shirts for the poor. An ounce of honey at five masari, a rotl of lamb meat at thirty masari, a rotl of garlic at twelve masari, a rotl of buffalo meat and beef at twenty masari, and an ounce of oil at two masari and a piece. We have never heard of such high prices ever. The wait has prolonged, and people are waiting for relief from the King, the Exalted.
The historian said: At the beginning of this new year, the noble descendant Sayyid Ahmad al-Baba, head of the tanners' guild, passed away. He, may Allah have mercy on him, was of beautiful appearance and good prestige, and we had companionship with him.
On the twenty-fourth of Muharram, was the entry of the Jukhadar from the Noble Hajj, bringing news of safety and good conduct. Then the writer came with the letters on the twenty-eighth of Muharram, Sunday, of this mentioned year.
At the end of Muharram, a massive torrent occurred in Damascus, the like of which had never been seen since ancient times. Following it, large hail fell, continuing for two hours, until it rose on the surface of the earth about a cubit and a half.
In the beginning of the month of Safar al-Khayr, news came about the Noble Hajj that it drowned in Al-Hasa near Al-Qatranah. It was said that about half the Hajj was lost, of horses, camels, mules, women, men, wealth, and loads. One merchant lost seventeen loads, each load priceless. They appealed to His Excellency Sulayman Pasha al-Azm, Governor of Damascus and Amir al-Hajj, saying: We gift you our wealth, take it yourself and do not leave it to the Arabs. Immediately he rose, took a group with him, and went for about a stage. He risked himself and his group, then was absent for a day and a night after they searched for him earnestly. Suddenly he was coming with the loads, not a speck diminished. Then he called them and handed them to their owners, and his Hajj was not sullied by anything. They counted this feat for the likes of him, from high aspirations and lofty chivalry.
Upon their arrival also at Al-Balqa, a great torrent also came, taking a huge amount of the Hajj, and wanted to finish off the rest of the Hajj, were it not that Allah rectified it with His kindness.
When this matter happened, His Excellency Amir al-Hajj Sulayman Pasha wrote a signature (decree) and sent it to Damascus and those around it, to bring him fodder and supplies. The crier called out in the streets of Damascus: O nation of Muhammad, whoever loves Allah and His Messenger, and is able to go out, let him go out, with whatever food, drink, and clothing he can, let him go out to meet the pilgrims. So creation went out like locusts.
On Sunday, the fourth of Safar al-Khayr, the Hajj entered, and the next day the Noble Mahmal entered with His Excellency Sulayman Pasha. It was a terrible year. The pilgrims reported that a mudd of fodder became two piastres, and in some places four piastres, and every three dates for a masriyyah. This is something unheard of since ancient times. A heel of rusk was sold for a third of a piastre.
Damascus was more expensive than others, until a mudd of salt reached thirty masari, dibs an ounce for a masriyyah, milk in Adhar a rotl for seven masari, bread was not found, and the rulers were hoarding, and the people of the city were doing as they did. To Allah is the destination.
On Monday, the thirteenth of Safar al-Khayr of this year, the working scholar Sheikh Amin Effendi Ibn al-Kharrat passed away, may Allah have mercy on him.
On the first of Rabi' al-Awwal of this year, His Excellency the Governor of Damascus, Sulayman Pasha Ibn al-Azm, began a celebration for the circumcision of his dear son Ahmad Bey. It was in the garden in the Amara district. He gathered in it all players, singers, Jews, and Christians. Notables and grandees of Effendis and Aghas gathered in it countlessly. He granted freedom for the players to play as they wished, of dancing, licentiousness, and other things. They continued in this state for seven days and nights. After that, he ordered decoration, so all the markets of Damascus were decorated for seven days, lighting candles and lamps, a decoration the like of which was not heard. He made a procession in which Aghas, Shurbajiyya, grandees, and Janissaries rode, and in it were strange games of representation of Arab braves and other things. The next day he circumcised his son Ahmad Bey, and ordered from his charity to circumcise whoever wanted from the children of the poor and others. So people started coming with their children, and whenever they circumcised a boy, they gave him a suit and two gold coins. He bestowed upon the elite and commoners, the poor and needy, food, clothing, and other things, such that no one had done some of what he did, nor did we hear of such generosity and favor upon the elite and commoners. May Allah have mercy on him and reward him with the best reward, Amen.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
After this great celebration, Fathi Effendi the Defterdar held a great celebration in this month, I mean Rabi' al-Awwal, marrying his daughter to his brother. It was a great celebration whose equal was not done in Damascus, nor did anyone hear that the like was done. It was seven days; each day he dedicated to a group: The first day he dedicated to His Excellency the Governor of Damascus Sulayman Pasha bin al-Azm, the second day to the Mawali (judges) and Amirs, the third day to the Sheikhs and Scholars, the fourth day to Merchants and Tradesmen, the fifth day to Christians and Jews, the sixth day to Peasants, and the seventh day to Singers and Prostitutes, who are the daughters of sin and passion. He was exceedingly generous to them, giving them gold and silver without account. Before the celebration, he held a Tahlila (gathering for remembrance), gathering in it all the Sheikhs of the Tariqas (Sufi paths).
On the twenty-sixth of Rabi' al-Awwal in this year, the Naqib of Naqibs in Damascus, over crafts, industries, and paths, Sheikh Abd al-Rahman son of Sheikh Muhammad al-Hallaq al-Qadiri, holder of the circle in the Umayyad Mosque, passed away.
On Thursday, the twenty-eighth of Rabi' al-Thani in this mentioned year, the happy young man, descendant of the pure ones, and pride of the Siddiqis, Ahmad Effendi al-Bakri al-Siddiqi passed away. He was of great nobility and was buried in the tomb of Sheikh Arslan, may Allah have mercy on him.
On Sunday, the first of Jumada al-Ula of this year, His Excellency Sulayman Pasha Ibn al-Azm began constructing and restoring the Qanawat River, and made all expenses from his own money, may Allah reward him with good. Two hundred laborers worked on it. He ordered cutting some rocks from its path, reinforcing its corners, repairing what was corrupted of it, raising its walls, and controlling it well, and correcting the shares of its beneficiaries in the true manner, so that every right holder takes his right. This construction and control was such that no one preceded him to it since its repair in the days of Timur when it was repaired after him. His construction was completed in a period of fifteen days at the beginning of the forty days of summer (Marba'aniyyat al-Sayf). When it was completed, he ordered the release of the river, so its release for the people of Damascus was a sight of the most joyful sights, and a day like the Day of Crowding. The Sheikh of Literature in Damascus, Sheikh Abd al-Rahman al-Bahlul, dated this construction, praising His Excellency Vizier Sulayman Pasha and indicating the date of completing the building, saying:
May the Master reward the Emir of Damascus good ... Sulayman of the time and may he last forever.
For what he renewed of the Qanawat sincerely ... with sincerity that grew secretly and openly.
So blessed is he for attaining a reward ... over the passage of nights continuously.
He has in every honor hands ... with benevolence that rose and so forth.
How many faces of righteousness his hands made ... by it date: Sabil al-khayr ajra (The path of good flowed).
On Tuesday, the sixteenth of Jumada al-Ula, the Sheikh, the Jurist, the Scholar Sheikh Ali, teacher of Izz al-Din Mosque in Bab al-Sarija, passed away, approaching eighty, may Allah Almighty have mercy on him.
On Saturday, the twenty-eighth of Jumada al-Ula of this year, the common people rose and attacked the court, expelled the judge, and looted the bakeries. The reason for that was the abundance of high prices, overcrowding at bakeries, and lack of inspection on the wheat owner, the miller, and the hoarder. His Excellency Governor Sulayman Pasha remedied this matter, sent intensifying [pressure] on the millers and bakers, threatening and frightening them. Immediately bread was found, improved, and became plentiful, after most people used to sleep without bread. So people implored with prayers for His Excellency.
On the sixth of Jumada al-Thani of this year, Sheikh Mustafa, son of our Sheikh and teacher, the Shafi'i of his time, and the virtuous of his era Sheikh Muhammad al-Ajluni, whom the Qanawat district was proud of, passed away, may Allah have mercy on him. By the decreed command, his wife died the first day, and he followed her the second day, may Allah Almighty have mercy on them both.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
On the seventh of Jumada al-Thani of this year, Sulayman Pasha went out intending to fight Zahir Umar, the ruler of Tiberias Fortress. He took with him about five hundred men from the army, dressed them in Kalpaqs (caps). They resembled the Albanians (Arnaut) and he called them the Aranta. A decree came to him from the Sublime Porte that the governor of Sidon, the governor of Tripoli, Jerusalem, Gaza, Ramla, and Irbid should go out with him. It was said that twenty thousand from the Druze Mountain rode with him. On the tenth day, he sent to the Aghas of the Janissaries to send him three hundred Janissaries, and send the remaining soldiers to protect the villages of Hauran. He also sent to all the villages of Damascus to bring out ten individuals from each village, to protect with the Janissaries as well. Then he marched with those groups, and encamped at Marj al-Qadas (with Fatha on Qaf and Dal) in the land of the Matawila. He sent for Prince Mulhim, who came to him with two hundred horsemen.
After a while, news came to Damascus that a fight occurred between the Druze and the Matawila. More than a thousand of the Matawila were killed, and the Druze burned their lands and looted their properties. Then the Matawila attacked the Druze and killed about five hundred men of the Druze. With them was Prince Haydar, owner of Deir al-Qamar Fortress. The Pasha forbade them, so they apologized to him, and he left them alone.
Then His Excellency Sulayman Pasha departed seeking Deir Hanna Fortress, and took with him the Sheikh of the Matawila Nassar with about four hundred people. The Druze returned, and he did not accept their assistance. In Deir Hanna Fortress was Abu Sa'd, the brother of Zahir Umar.
Al-Budayri said: In those days, news came to Damascus that the caravan which marched to Baghdad was taken by the Arabs. It contained wealth that cannot be counted by pen, including a ample gift from His Excellency Sulayman Pasha, Governor of Damascus, to Ahmad Pasha bin Hasan Pasha, Governor of Baghdad. Narrators reported that the Arabs who took the caravan were aides of the Kharijite who emerged from the land of Iraq, called Tahmasp, who overcame the King of Persia and took his land, and the King of India and took his land, and intended the city of Baghdad and besieged it most severely.
On the seventh day of Rajab, news came to Damascus that Sulayman Pasha Ibn al-Azm had died, and entered into the news of what was (i.e., became history). Immediately, Fathi Effendi bin al-Falaqinsi, Defterdar of Damascus, rose and sealed his houses, treasuries, and properties. He set a guard over that night and day, and confirmed Ali Agha the Mutasallim in his state, and wrote a petition about that and sent it to the Sublime State.
On the eve of Thursday, the eighth of Rajab of this year, at dawn time, they brought Sulayman Pasha in a litter, entered him into the Government Palace, washed him there, and buried him in the mid-morning in their cemetery in Bab al-Saghir, next to our master Bilal al-Habashi, in the grave where his son Ibrahim Bey is, by his will, may Allah Almighty have mercy on him broadly. He was a just, forbearing vizier, owner of good deeds and charities, loving scholars and people of righteousness. He abolished many injustices that were upon the people of Damascus, such as the Shashiyya, Mashyakha, and Ard, which are moneys imposed on crafts, industries, and neighborhoods in Damascus once or twice a year.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
The historian Al-Budayri said: Someone I trust informed me about the cause of his death, which is that he entered the bath of Acre and came out feverish. Zahir Umar, the ruler of Tiberias, sent him a letter asking for peace, but he refused and said: It is not possible except with your head. So Zahir Umar sent seeking his help, saying: Take whatever money you wish, leave bloodshed and fighting, and have mercy on women and children. Sulayman Pasha did not accept until he entered the bath and came out feverish. He knew he was inevitably dying, then he willed to be carried to Damascus and buried next to his son. Then he passed away, may Allah Almighty have mercy on him.
The Amirs concealed his death. The Alay Bey and the grandees of the state, the Kikhiya of Sulayman Pasha, departed from Acre, with the soldiers and cannons. They approached Tiberias, then fired cannons, and descended upon Tiberias, after placing the Pasha in the litter with the Jukhadariyya around him, and servants fanning him with fans right and left. They ordered the servants to call out among the soldiers as they passed: Allah grant you victory, O Abu Kharma, O Sulayman Pasha. Then he ordered the flags to be unfurled and the soldiers to line up and march. They passed Tiberias, and no one knew what happened.
When they reached the Bridge of Jacob's Daughters (Jisr Banat Ya'qub), it reached them that five thousand of the Matawila were lying in ambush for them. So they departed at the beginning of the night and marched earnestly. The Kind One (Al-Latif) was kind, and they reached Damascus at dawn. The day of their entry, the Janissaries rose and killed a group of Dalatiyya aggressively without cause.
As for Fathi Chalabi the Defterdar, he ordered the imprisonment of the Silahdar, Khazindar, Sayyid Muhammad Bey, cousin of Sulayman Pasha, and Muhammad Agha al-Dayri, the Wakeel al-Kharj (Expense Agent) and controller in Damascus. Their imprisonment was in Bab al-Agha, and he put under surveillance those with them of the group, and waited for the answer.
On Wednesday, the fourteenth of the month of Sha'ban of this year, news arrived that As'ad Pasha bin al-Azm, the ruler in Hama, had been confirmed for the Wilaya (governorate) of Damascus along with the Emirate of Hajj. So they kept its Mutasallim Ali Agha mentioned before until the arrival of the mentioned Pasha.
On that day, three messengers came from the Noble Medina, upon its dweller be the best prayers and perfect peace. They reported that Medina was besieged and that it was three alliances: an alliance with the Castle of Gaza, an alliance with the Tawashi (Eunuch/Guard), and an alliance with the people of Medina, and that they were in great distress. The Sharif of Mecca sent fifteen banners to the Tawashi to help him in that, and that the mentioned messengers were heading to Istanbul to inform His Excellency the Sultan of that situation.
On Saturday, the twenty-fifth of blessed Sha'ban falling in the year 1156, was the entry of As'ad Pasha Ibn al-Azm to Damascus as governor. His entry was from Masjid al-Aqsab, which is the neighborhood known among the people of Damascus as Mazz al-Qasab. He entered with a great procession of Janissaries and the grandees, princes, and notables of Damascus.
On the eve of Saturday, the Judge of Damascus ruled establishing the crescent of Ramadan. Cannons were fired shortly before Isha, and Tarawih was prayed in the Umayyad Mosque and all other mosques.
On the eve of Thursday, the fifth of the mentioned Ramadan, As'ad Pasha traveled with his army on the Dawra (tour), and left Ali Agha mentioned before as Mutasallim over the city. His departure was in moderate weather, and the city was in safety and much good. A rotl of bread was five masari, an ounce of ghee six masari, a rotl of rice nine masari, a rotl of meat eighteen masari, and a ghirara of wheat twenty-five piastres. The high prices were at this level, and there was no drought, locusts, or lack of rain, but from lack of inspection and attention.
His Excellency As'ad Pasha traveled and kept the aforementioned Mutasallim, and left everything as it was. Fathi Effendi the Defterdar mediated peace between Zahir Umar, the ruler of Tiberias, and His Excellency As'ad Pasha. So Zahir Umar sent him forty loads loaded with rice, sugar, and cloth. This is besides what Fathi the Defterdar appropriated for himself, for he was the Sultan in Damascus, possessor of effective speech, his word dictated affairs, while the command is delegated to the Possessor of Majesty.
In those days, news arrived that the Kharijite named Tahmasp arrived in the land of Iraq, took the city of Kirkuk, and is besieging Mosul and Baghdad, and has sold women and children. We ask Allah Almighty for kindness to the servants.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
In those days, the Ifta (position of Mufti) returned to Hamid Effendi Ibn al-Imadi. On the eve of Saturday, the moon eclipsed after midnight, a severe eclipse, and remained until the day broke.
On the fourteenth of the month of Ramadan of this year, a man threw himself from the top of the minaret of Al-Daqqaq Mosque to the ground; he perished quickly after his body broke. His name was Sheikh Hasan bin Sheikh Yusuf al-Rifa'i. We asked about the reason for that, and we were told that his wife's brother brought a woman to his house, and she was of the sinners. He forbade him from that, so he scolded and hit him. He went and informed the elders of the neighborhood, but they paid no attention to him because they were immersed in worse than that. So he went to Al-Daqqaq Mosque, prayed Fajr with the Imam, prayed the prayer of death upon himself, climbed the minaret and called out: O Nation of Islam, death is easier than pimping with the state of these days. Then he threw himself to the ground. May Allah forgive him.
On the eighteenth of this month, Ramadan, a man called Al-Majra put a pistol to his stomach and killed himself. We asked about the reason for that, and we were told this is a man in debt, so he killed himself due to the severity of his distress and oppression, although they told us they found with him about five sacks of stored wheat, so his soul did not allow him to sell any of it and pay his debt, so he lost his religion and worldly life.
On Tuesday, the twenty-fifth of Ramadan in this year, the people of Damascus closed their shops, and the Ashraf rose against the house of Fathi Effendi the Defterdar. The reason for that was that a follower of Fathi Effendi, called Al-Afsa, cursed Sayyid Ali Effendi the Naqib, and drew a weapon on him and on Sayyid Ali Effendi son of Sheikh Murad the Cripple in the Umayyad Mosque. The notables gathered, held a council, and issued a fatwa to kill him and spill his blood with impunity. A search for him ensued, so he hid in the house of Mustafa Agha bin Khudari the Shurbaji in the Maydan. This Al-Afsa shot at Sayyid Ali Effendi al-Muradi while he was entering his house but did not hit him. The city was disturbed, and the grandees, Aghas, Kapici, Baltajiyya, and Amin al-Surra gathered at the Judge's in the court. They made a petition against Fathi Effendi the Defterdar, that he is among the greatest corruptors, he and his followers, and wanted to send it to the Sublime State, but they waited for the arrival of His Excellency As'ad Pasha from the Dawra to seal it. The next day, their zeal became void, and their speech was as said: The speech of the night is erased by the day.
On the eve of Friday, the twenty-eighth of Ramadan, a slaughtered beggar was found in the Umayyad Mosque, at Bab al-Kallasa, with scattered flus (coins) on his chest. His adversary did not appear. It was said they thought they were gold, so they slaughtered him for that, and when they found them to be flus, they scattered them on him after killing him.
On Thursday, the fourth of Shawwal, As'ad Pasha arrived from the Dawra. On the ninth of Shawwal, Ali Agha Ibn al-Tarjuman passed away. He was a man whose praise among people was beautiful. Two days before, As'ad Pasha held a council and gathered the grandees and notables, and priced wheat and bread, making a ghirara of wheat twenty-five piastres, and a rotl of bread five masari. This matter of pricing does not hold straight, especially in Damascus.
On Monday, the fifteenth of Shawwal, As'ad Pasha departed as Amir al-Hajj with the Noble Mahmal, heading to Honorable Mecca. On Saturday the twentieth of Shawwal, the Noble Hajj departed. The season was winter, the sky was clear, and there was high prices and some plague. After the Pasha's travel, a rotl of bread remained at five masari, but a ghirara of wheat became thirty piastres. Then the common people clamored and stoned the judge, but it availed nothing.
The historian Al-Budayri said: On that day, our teacher, the Sheikh of the reciters of Damascus, Sheikh Ibrahim al-Hafiz, about whom the master of Damascus Sheikh Abd al-Ghani al-Nabulsi said: Whoever wants to hear the Quran as it was revealed, let him hear it from the mouth of Sheikh Ibrahim al-Nabulsi, benefited us by reading this blessed supplication, and its property against the attack of fears in travel and residence. It is this supplication: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. There has certainly come to you a Messenger from among yourselves. Grievous to him is what you suffer; [he is] concerned over you and to the believers is kind and merciful. In the name of Allah the Creator, the Greatest Bestower, a protection for every fearful one, there is no power for a creature with Allah Almighty. O Allah, I am in Your protection and under Your banner, so have mercy on Your protection and spread Your banner over us and uncover from us Your trial coming from Your earth and descending from Your sky... [words unclear] If they turn away, say: Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no deity except Him. On Him I have relied, and He is the Lord of the Great Throne.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
On Tuesday, the twenty-third of Shawwal, the learned scholar, jurist, and preacher Sheikh Ahmad al-Khatib passed away. He was the preacher and Imam in Al-Daqqaq Mosque in the Qubaybat district south of Damascus, which is the Lower Maydan at Bab Allah. The historian said: That district is my birthplace and where my head fell, and our home is in it. After our father's death, we moved from it to the Ta'dil district. The mentioned Sheikh Ahmad was a virtuous man; he revived that district with sciences and religion, and many Muslims benefited from him.
On the twenty-third of Shawwal of this year, a Silahshor arrived from the Sultan to collect Sulayman Pasha's money, amounting to twelve thousand purses. He entered Damascus like a flare of fire, and expelled Sulayman Pasha's harem from their homes atrociously. They began searching them one by one, searching their pockets and bosoms. He sealed all the rooms of the house, ordered the arrest of the late Sulayman Pasha's cousin, Sayyid Muhammad, and a group with him, and ordered strict surveillance over them. He asked about Muhammad Agha al-Dayri, Sulayman Pasha's expense agent, and they told him he went with As'ad Pasha to Hajj, so he ordered him to be brought. They brought him, and he ordered him to be put under surveillance.
The historian Al-Budayri said: Then the Silahshor summoned the judge and notables, brought Sulayman Pasha's harem, brought the executioner and torture instruments, and intensified the demand on the harem to inform him about where the money was hidden. When they saw the severity, they feared torture and confessed to him about some hiding places underground. He sent for the builders who built the Saraya, who were Christians, and the master was a Christian called Ibn Sayyaj. The Kapici ordered torturing them, cutting off their heads and hands. When they realized their torture, they said: We will show you everything that was done. Then they dug for him under the stairs, revealing a cellar. They removed the dirt from it, went down stairs, and a wide place appeared containing a locked chest with locks. They took it out and opened it, and saw it full of dirhams and riyals. Then the Christian took them out to a room, dug in its circles, and behold, there were seven jars full of Sultanic gold coins (Mahbub). When those present saw that state, their eyes deviated. Then they counted and recorded it, finding it to be eight hundred and fifty purses.
When people learned what came out of this money, and it was during days of severe high prices and bad conditions, they spoke with blame and punishment, saying he starved women, men, animals, and children until he collected this money from family owners, and did not observe Allah, the Possessor of Majesty.
Previously, a Kapici came to seize Sulayman Pasha's money, and seized two thousand and fifty purses, so he did not see it as anything. Fathi Effendi the Defterdar had bought most of his belongings and grains. He had wheat whose price reached twenty-five purses, reaching twenty-five piastres per ghirara, and the purse is five hundred piastres. Look how many ghiraras for twenty-five purses. There is no power or strength except with Allah.
Talk will come about Allah's seizure and anger with the mentioned Defterdar, because Allah Almighty delays but does not neglect. And do not think Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do.
On the twenty-fourth day, Saturday of the month of Dhu al-Qi'dah, Sheikh Muhammad al-Maktabi and his son passed away in the plague intensifying in these times. He was an Imam in the Qal'i Mosque and a Kuttab teacher in the Kharratin district. He died at the beginning of the day, and his son at its end.
The beginning of this plague was early autumn, in late summer, and it continued until winter entered and increased greatly. It was said that with the entry of the new year it would go.
In early Dhu al-Hijjah, a star with a tail rose from the west, continuing until shortly after winter, and persisted until the new year entered.

Year 1157
Its entry was the first of Muharram al-Haram, Saturday, the year one thousand one hundred and fifty-seven, 1157. The star with a tail continued to rise from the west, then began rising from the east with its tail to the west.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
In those days, the Sheikh of the Takiyya killed himself. In that year, prostitutes multiplied, displaying themselves day and night. One night, the Judge of Damascus went out after Asr to Salihiyya, and encountered a woman from the prostitutes named Salamun, behaving riotously in the road, drunk and with uncovered face, holding a knife. The Judge's group shouted at her to move out of the way, the Judge is coming. She laughed, shouted, and attacked the Judge with the knife. His aides pushed her away from him. Then the Judge gathered the Governor and the Mutasallim, and mentioned to him what happened with this whore. They told him this is a prostitute named Salamun, and most people are infatuated with her, such that every need or item is attributed to her, saying: this is Salamuni goods, this is a Salamuni dress. The Mufti issued a fatwa to kill her and shed her blood with impunity to quell the sedition. They searched for her and killed her. They sent a crier to call in the city that whoever sees a girl of error and passion (prostitute) should kill her and her blood is shed with impunity. So a number of them traveled and the rest hid. Despite that, the plague was camped in Damascus and its suburbs, with high prices and stagnation of prices.
On Wednesday, the nineteenth of Muharram of this year, a noble decree arrived from the Sublime State to the Kapici who came to seize Sulayman Pasha's money, to gather the city's notables and read the Firman to them. Its content was to search and inspect the remnants of the mentioned Pasha, and to torture men and women without opposition until they confess about the money. They answered with hearing and obedience. The first one he brought was the Pasha's cousin Sayyid Muhammad and threatened him. He swore by divorce that he had no knowledge. It was said he beat him, so he confessed to a place and said dig here. They dug in the Pasha's house around the fireplace. They found four jars of gold, containing sixteen thousand gold pieces.
Then they beat the Tawashi (Eunuch), so he confessed that a nosebag full of riyals was deposited with a man called Hasan al-Tarabulsi. The notables went to him and brought him and the money. They took it out and found inside the nosebag among the money a jewel with no value, and saw the money less than what the Tawashi said. The Kapici ordered the imprisonment of the one from whom the money came, and imprisonment of his children and those related to him. He ordered the presence of the Pasha's women and harem. We mentioned first that he expelled them from the house by force and left them under surveillance. Now he ordered bringing them, so they brought them and he interrogated them, but they denied. So he ordered their imprisonment, and they were imprisoned in Bab al-Barid and it was tightened on them.
Sulayman Pasha had a concubine preferred over all his favorites named Zahra, like the full moon in the horizon of the sky. The Kapici had left her with Sulayman Bey, Sulayman Pasha's agent over his properties, under surveillance. When the decree came to him to punish men and women, he ordered her brought, and asked her about the money. She denied and claimed she saw nothing and knew nothing. He ordered beating her, so she was beaten on her face, hands, and sides until she lost her senses, yet she confessed nothing, swearing she had no knowledge or news and her master Sulayman Pasha did not inform her of anything. He left her under surveillance, because he is a mean tyrant and accursed devil with no compassion for the harem; may Allah punish him with the fire of Hell, on a Day when neither wealth nor children will benefit, except him who comes to Allah with a sound heart.
Then after that, the Kapici gathered all the Pasha's harem, slaves and free women, all at once, and took all they had of gold, silver, goods, jewelry, clothes, and everything women possess, after torture, humiliation, and severe beating. May Allah fight him with skins having no tanner and punish him with the fire of eternity.
Then Sulayman Pasha had a wife who was the daughter of Sheikh Yasin al-Qadiri. When she saw what befell her companions of humiliation, the Kapici asked her about her husband the Pasha's money and threatened her with torture. She feared and gave him a form of gold worth ten purses, and gave him Tamassukat (bonds), which are documents against some merchants for about one hundred and fifty purses. All that money was inheritance from her father Sheikh Yasin al-Qadiri, may Allah have mercy on him and sanctify his secret.
All this situation while As'ad Pasha al-Azm was in Hajj. When As'ad Pasha came from Hajj, he held a council, and the Kapici attended and produced a noble decree that his command is delegated to do what he wishes of torture, killing, and imprisonment, and no one opposes him. People thought that As'ad Pasha would rise and sit for that [in anger], but the matter turned out otherwise, and he stood and did not move a motionless object. Taking Sulayman's revenge from Fathi Effendi the Defterdar will come soon. Then after a while, a decree of pardon (Afu Nameh) came. They gathered Muhammad Agha Ibn al-Dayri, Sayyid Muhammad cousin of Sulayman Pasha, and Sayyid Sulayman. They sold the wheat, properties, and what remained of goods and armory to As'ad Pasha for four hundred purses.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
On Thursday, the fifth of Jumada al-Ula, the mentioned Kapici traveled to Istanbul. People thought that As'ad Pasha, nephew of Sulayman Pasha, would do something to the Kapici and Fathi the Defterdar, but nothing occurred from him. His planning for the destruction of the Defterdar will come soon.
At the end of Jumada al-Thani, news came from the Sublime State summoning Fathi Effendi the Defterdar. He went accompanied by the Kapici who came to summon him.
On the fifth day of Rajab, the notables of Damascus banded together and made a petition against Fathi Effendi stating that he is one of the corruptors. The matter was not completed with them due to the difference in their word.
On the eve of the twenty-third of Rajab, after Isha, the sky split and a great calamity descended from it, and this became famous among the people. The historian said: I did not see it with my own eyes.
On the eighth day of Sha'ban, the Judge of Damascus Muhammad Effendi Zade entered. He was a rational man, except that he had no politics or management.
On the fourteenth day of the month of Ramadan in this year, Fathi Effendi the Defterdar came from Istanbul and entered Damascus with joy and happiness, and no harm touched him. The reason for that was what he spent in Istanbul of money that sways the hearts of men. He was counted on the Kizlar (Agha) and a group of senior state leaders. It was said that he entered Istanbul secretly and distributed money secretly and openly. The Sultan had summoned him, so they dressed a man in his outfit and brought him into the King. He reprimanded him with words and for what occurred from him, and the complaints sent by the people of Damascus against him. Every time His Excellency King Mahmud Khan said a word to him, he would signal with his head 'yes'. The one who brought him in had ordered him to do so. Immediately he ordered his killing, so he was killed, while he thought it was Fathi Effendi the Defterdar. Then they ordered Fathi to reach Damascus at night.
At the end of Dhu al-Hijjah, the flus (copper coins) which were struck in Damascus were invalidated.

Year 1158
Then the year one thousand one hundred and fifty-eight entered on Tuesday.
The matter of the Zarbawat, the wretches, transgressing aggravated. They went to extremes in cursing religion, oppressing people, and other things. The ruler of Damascus, His Excellency As'ad Pasha, did not move a motionless object, and did nothing, until they began calling him Sa'diyya Qadin (Lady Sa'diyya), sleeping with the sleepers, while we see wretches making honor and wealth permissible. However, the city was calm from movements and safe from the oppression of rulers.
On the fifteenth of Jumada al-Thani, the virtuous Sheikh, the belief of the people of Damascus absolutely, Sheikh Yusuf al-Tabbakh al-Khalwati passed away. The historian said: Among what Allah bestowed upon me is that I shaved his head and seized the opportunity of his supplication, may Allah have mercy on him and be pleased with him.
On Monday, the twenty-first of Jumada al-Thani of this year, the common people rose due to lack of bread and high prices and attacked the Saraya, raising their voices with weeping and supplication, saying: Lack of compassion for the servants who were harmed by high prices is not lawful by Allah, and you are the ruler of Damascus and responsible before Allah for us and these conditions. As'ad Pasha said to them: Go to the court and complain about your condition to the Judge. So they approached towards the court, and screamed in it complaining of their condition, what befell them, and what is happening to them. The Judge's group came out with sticks and expelled them, and that was by the order of his deputy. The common people attacked and stoned them. The Judge ordered his aides to shoot with gunpowder, so they shot them, killing a noble man (Sharif) among them and wounding a group. The common people raided them, and some Janissaries helped them. They defeated the Judge, killed the Bash Jukhadar and some of his aides, looted the court and burned its door. People closed the city. Some Aghas rode and turned the people back. As for the Judge, he fled over the roofs, he and his deputy and group. Some grandees took him and consoled him. The Judge swore not to live this month except in the Citadel. Then they gathered the Judge's money and goods, and what was missing they imposed on the treasury of the regiment (Ojak) and on some grandees and notables. They pleased the Judge, reconciled him, and returned him to the court.
On the day of the twenty-eighth of Jumada al-Thani, the ascetic Sheikh, possessor of states and miracles, Sheikh Ahmad al-Nahlawi al-Ahmadi passed away, and was buried in his Zawiya where he resided next to Sitti Khatun Shah sister of the Just King Sultan Nur al-Din, famous as the Court Alley.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
Then in these times, the cost of prices increased, rains decreased, and the affairs of fools and evildoers became great, until a rotl of cheese became half a piastre, an egg a masriyyah, an ounce of sesame oil (siraj) half a third, a mudd of barley half a piastre, a mudd of chickpeas half a piastre, a mudd of lentils half a piastre, a ghirara of wheat forty-five piastres after it was twenty-five piastres, an ounce of tahini four masari, dibs every three rotls a piastre, a rotl of honey a piastre and a quarter, and everything's price rose above custom, until a mudd of salt became half a piastre.
In those days, Mustafa Agha Ibn al-Qabbani, the Kikhiya of the Janissaries, perished from a disease that doctors were unable to cure. He was among those who hoarded food and wished high prices for Allah's creation, so Allah made punishment and retribution. It reached me about him that when they wanted to bury him, they dug a grave for him and found a huge snake in it, so they dug another and found likewise, until they dug several graves finding the snake. I said: This has preceded in the past for some oppressors. They found in his estate one hundred ghiraras of sesame, while in the whole city not a mudd of sesame was found. They found much wheat. He was asked to sell a ghirara of wheat for forty-five piastres but he refused, and swore not to sell it except for fifty. So he perished and sold nothing, and it was sold in his estate. Allah showed mercy to His servants by his death because He is the Most Merciful of the merciful.

Year 1159
Then the year one thousand one hundred and fifty-nine entered, and its first day was Sunday. Its judge Mustafa Effendi entered, preceded by his aides carrying guns and weapons, until he reached the court. This did not happen to anyone else. Then he sat in the court not moving a motionless object, may Allah grant him success. The ruler in Damascus and the Wali there was His Excellency the Perilous Vizier As'ad Pasha Ibn al-Azm, may Allah support him and strengthen his word. He was absent in Hajj, and the Mutasallim and Kikhiya was Musa. But high prices were standing on foot and leg (rampant) along with distress, fear, and discord.
On the third of Safar, the Hajj entered Damascus on Thursday accompanied by its Great Amir and Magnified Vizier His Excellency Al-Hajj As'ad Pasha al-Azm. He and the pilgrims were in utmost health and safety. Then after that, he sent demanding the Dalatiyya urgently. When the Janissaries saw that, the earth narrowed upon them, and they said like their previous sayings in lack of manners: Lady Sa'diyya wants to betray us, and this matter does not scare us. Then they increased in carrying weapons, looting money, violating honor, cursing religion, and other atrocities.
When they increased in arrogance and lethality, and did not observe the Presence of the Truth, Exalted is His Majesty, Allah Almighty sent from His anger a severe wind upon Damascus the like of which had not been seen in past days. It uprooted trees from their roots and threw down most walls, until people thought the Resurrection had risen.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
On Monday, the twenty-second of Safar of this mentioned year, while people were at their work before noon, suddenly there was a great noise and gunfire. It was asked: What is the news? It was said: The Dalatiyya took possession of the Citadel. The city closed down and panic increased in everyone. When the news reached the Janissaries, they rose on foot and leg. They said: The Citadel has been taken from us, O youth. They gathered at Bab al-Jabiya with full weapons waiting for the fight.
When the news reached His Excellency As'ad Pasha, he rejoiced and was happy, and called out: Seek Suq Saruja and be diligent in the pursuit. He ordered them to leave the Qibla side, and that was a trick and deception from him. Then he called out among his soldiers a call that spread in the city that Murad Ahmad bin al-Qaltaqji and Abdullah bin Hamza and their followers [were targets]. They were among the leaders and princes of Suq Saruja. The music/dancers (Jank) were playing in Suq Saruja, as if there was no ruler in Damascus but them, so Allah wanted their destruction.
Then His Excellency the Pasha ordered cannons to be directed at Suq Saruja. They directed what they had and he ordered striking it with balls, so it was struck. In less than a short while, houses burned, homes were demolished, Al-Qaltaqji's house burned and was annihilated to the last, and soldiers looted everything in it. Then looting spread to the rest of the houses. They looted, killed, mutilated, and innovated [in torture]. The good and bad went, until the Suq Saruja district became a barren plain. As for Ibn al-Qaltaqji, he fled escaping after he and his group exerted the utmost bravery.
Then His Excellency the Pasha ordered cannons to be turned towards Al-Maydan, so they directed them. The head of the corruptors there was Mustafa Agha bin Khudari Jurbaji, to the point he named himself Sultan of Damascus, and he had a gang of wretches strengthening him. Also there were the sons of Al-Darzi, Ahmad Agha and Khalil Agha, and they had power and authority there. When it reached these corruptors that His Excellency As'ad Pasha directed cannons with soldiers against them, Allah cast terror into their hearts, and they resorted to escape and flight, seeking deserts and wastelands. With their defeat and flight, the hearts of the remaining brave ones of Al-Maydan broke. Some fled and joined their masters, some were buried in caves and graves, and some dived into rivers.
When the cannons reached Al-Maydan, they found no one defending. The first thing soldiers busied themselves with was demolishing the house of Ibn Khudari, after looting all goods and other things in it. They did likewise to the house of Ibn Hamza and other houses, until they looted about five hundred houses. After that, they busied themselves with demolishing the houses they looted.
His Excellency As'ad Pasha, may Allah make him happy and strengthen him, sent news to the Sheikhs of the neighborhoods there and their Imams to arrest the remaining wretches present, and if they did not, he would fine them with huge sums of money. So they began tracking the wretches one by one, saying to His Excellency the Pasha: This wretch is so-and-so, and this Agha is so-and-so, and this Shurbaji is so-and-so. His Excellency the Pasha would order beheading them in front of the Saraya gate and leaving their bodies for dogs to eat for a long time, until they became a lesson for those who take heed. Then Damascus calmed down after that, and became like a cup of milk. People became safe and secure, and honors were protected. The Pasha possessed the city with about four hundred Dalatiyya soldiers. The wilderness became safe. That was by his strong determination after the leaders of Al-Maydan and their aides used to say: If ten Pashas came to us, including the Sultan, we would not account for them, and we would shred their tails with pistols. Look now, they have become more humiliated than flies and food for the vilest dogs.
As for the sons of Ibn al-Darzi, they fled and took refuge with the Arabs of Ibn Kulayb, they and their followers. As for Ibn Hamza and his followers, they fled towards Tiberias and took refuge with Zahir Umar. The sons of Al-Qaltaqji and their followers fled to the Druze Mountain. Whoever of them fell, they made his skin into patches. The greatest calamity and disappointment was for the house of Hasan Turkman; five men were killed from them: Hamza Bey, Muhammad Agha, Hasan Agha, Khalil Agha, and their groom. They were among the corruptors, oppressors, harmers, violators of harems, cursers of religion, except Hamza Bey, for he was contrary to that; he went by mistake and in vain.
The city was decorated, cannons fired morning and evening for two months, and the nauba (music) with fireworks. Allah sufficed the believers in fighting, and the remnant of the people who wronged were cut off. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds.
The historian Al-Budayri said: I said describing them in Mawaliya:
Where is the slippery shoe (Zallaqa) that was like a sword ... Boots they don't take off in winter or summer.
If one sees his friend he doesn't say how are you ... That Zallaqa has passed, oh alas, oh alas.

book_title: Daily Events of Damascus (Hawadith Dimashq al-Yawmiyyah)
text:
At the end of Rabi' al-Thani, His Excellency As'ad Pasha al-Azm sent a huge army to the city of Baalbek to kill its governor, Emir Hussein. They found no trace of him. The aides entered, looted, robbed, and did what they did. Then they brought eight men from the notables of Baalbek, including its Mufti, to Damascus. Its mentioned Mufti was hanged, and the rest were beheaded.
In those days, His Excellency As'ad Pasha sent a number of troops to the Arabs. They returned with heads of Arabs, camels, sheep, loot, and other things. His Excellency As'ad Pasha mentioned terrified the great and small, and his reputation became great even in the deserts and wastelands. They began adding 'Al-Hajj' to his name, saying: Al-Hajj As'ad Pasha.
In these days, a Kapici came from the Sublime State with a royal gift from His Excellency the Sultan to His Excellency Al-Hajj As'ad Pasha, which was a magnificent Fur (Kurk), a royal sword, robes of honor, andتشريفات (Tashrifat - investitures/honors). That had not happened before for other ministers and rulers, except to the Grand Vizier, holder of the Seal, if he was in a war campaign and conquest of lands happened at his hand. Glory be to the Giver, the Granter.
The State had, since a not distant time, removed the regiments of Kapikulu from Damascus, and wrapped turbans were not seen. His Excellency As'ad Pasha, may Allah preserve him, sent requesting regiments from the State. They sent him the Orta (regiment) of On Dokuz (Nineteen). It entered with a great procession, pleasing some people and distressing others. Some wretches wanted to raise their heads, so they informed His Excellency the Pasha about that. He sent saying to the Agha: Whoever enters it from the children of Damascus not of your race, the blame returns only upon yourself. So the situation was organized, the state of the Kapikulu strengthened in Damascus, they wrapped turbans, and their state returned better than it was.
In Jumada al-Ula of this year, locusts arrived in Damascus. They had been camping around it for years. They descended on its orchards, eating until they left nothing. His Excellency the Pasha sent two experts to bring him the water of the Samarmar (starling bird). This year had abundant rains, bounties, fruits, and plants. Despite that, the people of Damascus were in great distress from high prices, and prices rose for all goods.
His Excellency As'ad Pasha, may Allah preserve him, held a council and sent for wheat sellers, demanding them to bring wheat and threatening them. They swore to him that they had nothing and none was found. He said to them: I have much wheat in Hama, so request it. They sent requesting all wheat found belonging to His Excellency the Pasha and others. Loads of wheat came to them from Hama without count, and they sold it in Damascus at the current price. Despite that, a rotl of bread was five masari, and this hardship has prolonged.
On Sunday after Asr, the fifteenth of Jumada al-Thani of this year, cannons were fired. I asked people about the news.
